title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 441.321 - Teaching program (nonapproved)
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 441.321 - Teaching program (nonapproved)

State Regulations

To be a nonapproved teaching program means that, a
medical internship or residency training program is not approved by the Council
of Medical Education of the American Medical Association or, in the case of an
osteopathic hospital, is not approved by the Committee on Hospitals of the

Bureau of Professional Education of the American Osteopathic Association. An
intern or residency program in the field of dentistry is not approved unless
approval has been received by the Council on Dental Education of the American

Dental Association. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10
ยง
441.321

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
